Condition.Diagnostic: Regular simultanious mode should not be available for injected conversion

PossibleValue.Comment: Dual regular simultaneous + alternate trigger mode

Condition.Diagnostic: Regular simultanious mode should not be available for injected conversion

PossibleValue.Comment: Dual combined regular simultaneous + injected simultaneous mode
Dual regular simultaneous + alternate trigger mode
Dual Interleaved mode + injected simultaneous mode

RefParameter.Name: Mode
RefParameter.Description: Multi ADC mode selection: Configures the ADC to operate in independent or multi mode

Condition.Diagnostic: DMA access mode should be available only if multi mode is used in regular simultanious
DMA Access mode 3 is used in interleaved mode in 6-bit and 8-bit resolutions.

RefParameter.Name: TwoSamplingDelay
RefParameter.Description: Delay between 2 sampling phases

RefParameter.Name: ClockPrescaler

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: The Clock prescaler can't be set to synchronous DIV1 since the AHB prescaler is different from DIV1.

RefParameter.Description: frequency of the clock to the ADC. The clock is common for all the ADCs.

RefParameter.Name: Resolution

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /4 for resolution 12 or 10 bits.
In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /4 for resolution 12 or 10 bits.
In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /3 for resolution 8 bits.
In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /2 for resolution 6 bits.

RefParameter.Description: Resolution of the ADC conversion

RefParameter.Name: DataAlign

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: The alignment mode is not available in both Regular and Injected coversion: working with oversampling the data are always provided right-aligned

RefParameter.Description: Select the alignment of the data stored after conversion.

RefParameter.Description:
The alignment mode is available only on for Injected conversion.
Regular conversion working with oversampling: the data are always provided right-aligned.

RefParameter.Description:

RefParameter.Name: Overrun
RefParameter.Description: Select the behaviour in case of overrun

RefParameter.Name: LowPowerAutoWait
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the usage of Low Power Auto Wait Mode: new conversion start only when the previous conversion (for regular group) or previous sequence (for injected group) has been treated by user software.

RefParameter.Name: EnableRegularConversion
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable Regular Conversion

Shift for oversampling should be equal or greater than 2

Shift for oversampling should be equal or greater than 4
Oversampling Continued Mode available only when Injected Oversampling Disabled

PossibleValue.Comment: Single trigger for all oversampled conversions

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Multi-Trigger Oversampled conversion available Only When: Oversampling Resumed Mode Selected And Injected Oversampling Disabled

RefParameter.Description: Select the external event used to trigger the start of conversion of a regular group

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConvEdge

PossibleValue.Comment: Trigger detection on the rising edge
Trigger detection on the falling edge
Trigger detection on the rising and falling edges

RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group: When an external trigger is selected for ADC regular or injected conversion, only the rising edge of the signal can start the conversion.

Trigger detection on the falling edge
Trigger detection on the rising and falling edges

RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group: When an external trigger is selected for ADC regular or injected conversion, only the rising edge of the signal can start the conversion.
